intro: Euphrasia gundisalvi, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Euphrasia gundisalvi is often found in meadows and open woodlands at high elevations.
